, Delavan is home to Lake Delavan and Comus Lake as well as Lake Lawn Resort.
Delavan is accessible via Interstate 43 and is located within five miles of US Route 14.  Routes 50 and 11 are the primary east-west thoroughfares.
Delavan can be traveled by car or on foot.  WI 11 and 50 provide access to the vast majority of the city.

value: address=Intersection of Walworth Avenue and 3rd Street
content=Home of numerous quaint restaurants, bakeries, antique stores, clothing retailers and the famous circus statues at Water Tower Park.
content=One of Delavan's two arboretums, the Paul Lange Arboretum is also a canoe launch for Lake Comus and has a 1.5 mile nature trail.
During the winter, the Rudy Lange Sledding Hill is a major attraction for the city's kid.
A country cafe serving breakfast, lunch and dinner.  Combo specials are inexpensive and delicious.
directions=Hwy 50 to North Shore Dr. t Beckman Dr.

content=The historic "Inn Between" bar & grill on Delavan Lake. This renowned establishment is situated on 70' of prime waterfront with 2 piers to cater to the lake clientele and a large parking lot for those traveling by car or cycle. The last true tavern left on Delavan Lake features inside and outside dining along with a spacious picnic area for fun and games. Known as "the place to be" the Inn Between has many upgraded amenities including 10 beers on tap, outside deck with lakeviews and a Tiki Bar.
